description: Found this place searching for restaurants near Japantown. Pleasantly surprised. Great vibe and love the K-pop videos. The staff was extremely nice and professional. Love the food - Millionaires Bacon and Kimchee Fried Rice was delicious.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Pretty disappointing. Saw this on Instagram and it looked amazing. We got the taco wasabi, which wasn't too bad and the KFC from the HH menu. I don't know how to feel about a $6 plate of 3 small pieces. Also, the $23 pot of army stew is so mediocre and not worth it. All that was in there were onions, zucchini, spam, and instant noodles. 

10/10 would not recommend. This place doesn't give me any good memories of food. I normally don't write reviews on yelp but I need to share this experience with everyone so you won't feel hungry after this meal like me.


Only giving these 2 stars for the service.
author: Olivia C.

description: This place is amazing. The staff is very helpful. But the best part is the food. OMG. Everything we had was absolutely delicious and the $20 bottomless mimosas sealed the deal. We will be returning!
author: Jillian G.

description: The hangover stew - that's all you need in your life. ITS THE BEST! OMG,, still dreaming about how god it was a few weeks ago! The soft shell crab benny was okay - It was beautiful and I thought it would be a lot better.. but iono maybe the combo isn't that bomb?? The customer service is great. It gets filled quickly so be sure to make ressies.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Everything is delicious.
Especially recommend Kimchi jun.
It's a little bit spicy but great.

I love this palce ! 
It's good that the palce is wild.
I will be back for my friend's birthday !
author: Kang M.

description:
Luxurious modern interior design and great atmosphere. 
The menu has Korean, Japanese, American and fusion food. Great variety and excellent quality. I had the Sticks (chicken & cheese sticks), S. S. Sunomono, the Yaki udon and the Scallops& asparagus. Highly recommend all, honestly. Great quality seafood and meat. The sticks were hot and crispy. Scallops were soft and creamy sauce went very well with the scallops and asparagus. My favorite was S. S. Sunomono. 
The seafood was in such high quality and the house special sauce was truly special - sour and spicy. Addicting! The drink is marshmallow latte, a hot cocktail. My love for coffee and alcohol in one cup. Lastly, waiters and waitresses were very kind and checked on us often. Such a pleasant time overall!
author: Yoojin K.

description:
Fillmore Social Club (FSC) is a bit unusual for Western Addition, but that may be part of what makes it so good. The area has several good jazz clubs and a few decent bars, but restaurants tend to be (with a couple of exceptions) fast food or super expensive and difficult to get in (yeah, I'm talking about State Bird Provisions). Anyway, FSC is a modern Korean restaurant, that's a few blocks from Japan Town and in the heart of what used to be called "Harlem of The West."

Well... let's get to the nitty gritty: food at FSC is fresh, tasty and reasonably priced service is prompt and friendly and ambiance is young and vibrant (lots of pop and hip hop music).

The best food they have is on their small plates part of the menu, where dishes range from $5 to $12, but mostly in the $5 to $7 range. KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) with hot sauce may be their best, but they have a host of options that are fun to try.

FSC is relatively new. I've been there four times and each time the food and service has been better than the last. They may be up to 5 stars by next year.
author: Tushar N.

description:
Best Brunch I ever had
Nice staff
Delicious food
Good music
New things to try
I highly recommend this place
author: Aala D.

description: I was a little disappointed when I went for dinner on Sunday evening.  I heard great things about the place and they did not have Kimchi fried rice or army stew.  We were told that they were going to be bringing it back in two weeks or so, but they still offer it for brunch.  It wasn't very clear about why it wasn't being offered, so we had to settle for other things.  We each got the spicy ramen which wasn't too bad, but the the fries, rice cake, and sausage was a miss for me.  I wasn't a huge fan of the fries.  I wish the rice cakes were in my soup rather than fried.  I ended up putting the sausage in my ramen which went pretty well together, but if I had just had the trio, it would have been difficult to finish.  The spicy KFC was nothing special.  I personally liked that it was boneless because.  We got the millionaire's bacon as well which didn't blow my mind.  I've had several versions of millionaire's bacon dishes across SF and this one wasn't the best in the city.  Overall, it wasn't a home run of a dinner, but I am definitely willing to go back for brunch or lunch.
author: Lynne T.

description:
*edit* My apologies, the worst ASIAN/FUSION/Any type of food I have ever tasted. I think you'll get the idea once you notice all the empty tables.

I am puzzled as to why this place has 4 stars. Possibly the worst Korean food I've ever had in my entire life. Not being extra judgmental just because I'm Korean but food was completely inedible. Korean pancake was soggy, very strange texture and taste. Workers were very nice but something has to be done about the food.
author: Amy K.

description: Excellent Choice for Korean Brunch experience!!! Great Service, delicious food, tasty drinks!!
author: Galia R.

description:
Not worth the price. I've been a here a couple of times because I live nearby, and I was disappointed every time. The most recent time I actually had such a bad experience that I'm writing a review - something I normally don't do.

- Just okay food - the scallops tasted rubbery not fresh; bulging was just drenched in sauce flavor, nothing special. 
- Overpriced - for mediocre food, the price was 1.5X of other Korean restaurants in the city
- Pushy waiter - the waiter kept telling us what to get without invitation. In the beginning, without giving us time to look over the menu, she just started to telling us what we should get. At the end, she just stated to us: "you guys want dessert", which we didn't. Her pushiness really added to a negative experience for me.

Would not recommend.
author: Yian L.

description:
What a pleasant surprise!  I look forward to coming back and if the quality keeps up making it a regular spot. 

We tried mostly the fried dishes -- the octopus and the chicken -- and also the soju taster. The soju cocktails are a tad sweet for me. But the recommended Japanese beer was great and went well with the food. 

The "fusion" take on Korean food was tasty and I hope to try some of the other dishes as well. 

Service was also really good.
author: T. F.

description: My experience at Filmore Social Club was very very mediocre at best. The kalbi we ordered came with 8-9 small, charred pieces that cost us $25 (see attached picture) and a lot of the pieces only had bone, no meat. The beef in the ssam was super dry. And unlike other Korean restaurants, Filmore doesn't provide any banchan and charges for rice, kimchi, and tea lol ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Evanny H.

description:
I came here on the first day it opened with a few friends and had a great time. The atmosphere is the main thing that makes this place stand out. There really is a lot of work put in, even down to the small details. That same attention to detail is reflected in the food as well. The presentation is great, especially on the cocktails. Although the price was higher than other Korean restaurants, the ingredients were high quality and the portions were on the bigger side for the mains. They also offer lettuce wraps which go well with the Jae-yook! The dish called 'good choice' was also delicious but I wish it had more rice cakes in it, they seemed more like an after thought. The bulgogi ssam was a yummy appetizer but it is a big difficult to share the 3 pieces among four  people without it getting a bit messy. The sticks is a great appetizer to share with friends over some drinks. Their beer selection selection is curated and has a lot of rare beers not commonly seen elsewhere.
Overall this place is great for hanging out with friends and getting a bite to eat. And its also good if you mainly want to drink with only a few appetizers to share. I love having this great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Summer B.

description: I lived in Seoul, the food here is right on point; great, friendly service; hip, young crowd; great selection of booze.
author: Michael Y.

description:
This place was underwhelming.

The first thing I noticed was the dishware. The cups and plates are made of glossy stainless steel. That felt cheap to me, and my date told me it made her think of prison.

The menu was very confusing to me, being mostly unfamiliar with Korean food. I would have appreciated advice from the waitress or the menu itself, since I don't think I made the most satisfying choice.

We settled the udon and the bulgogi, and sides of rice and kimchi. The udon was tasty and had an interesting texture, and I'd recommend trying it. The bulgogi came out as a literal pile of meat, which I assumed was meant to be shared, but it wasn't clear me when I ordered. It was good, but I felt pretty stupid eating a plate of beef with nothing else by myself. The rice ($2.5) and kimchi ($3) were very small portions for the price. The kimchi was not especially flavorful, and I wouldn't recommend ordering it. (It is also is served on an "I-beam" kind of plate, which made it very hard to eat from since it'd topple over if you tried to stab it with a fork. I don't understand that decision.)

We considered cocktails, but they were pretty expensive ($16 and up). They serve them in small glasses with a carafe, which I had never seen before. Maybe good for sharing.

Alright service, clean space, trendy decor.

Overall, I don't regret trying this place, but wouldn't recommend it. Maybe I lack an appreciation for Korean food, but if you're also the adventurous type, I think you can do better at this price point elsewhere in the city.
author: Ceasar B.

description:
Excellent Korean restaurant 
Food 5star 
Service 3.5 star 
Bathroom 4star. 
Nice mixed menu.
author: James L.

description: I got the cool cucumber drink ($16) and the half & half ($18). The chicken could be more spicy (it's not spicy at all). It was tasty and crispy though. The waiters are super nice! All in all, decent food but not quite worth the price.
author: Jackie L.

description: If you're down by down FILLMORE street, this is a must go to dinner drink spot. Steeped in tradition and serving the perfect food like korean style. Pull up to the bar and have 1-2 before heading home. Great place to relax with friends.
author: Miyoung J.

description:
Came here for dinner last night. The restaurant was decorated nicely, and the service was very pleasant. I was super excited to try some of their drinks I saw pics of on yelp, especially the cotton candy soju drink. Unfortunately they were no longer serving it, or the soju flight I was also looking forward to. I settled on the matcha mojito. The drink was enjoyable, but cost $17 ! In my opinion, that's outrageous for one soju cocktail. All the drinks were pretty pricy, the Japanese lager was also $9 which is pretty steep for one beer. 
We ordered a few different plates and shared them all. My favorite was the ssam, which are ribeye lettuce wraps. The jaeyook, Korean spicy pork was also good. We ordered a side of kimchi which was $3 for a small side was a little high also as most Korean restaurants will load you up on kimchi complementary. 
It's a nice addition to the neighborhood but with these prices, I'm not sure I'll be returning.
author: brittany g.

description: I loved the interior of the restaurant. It was very calming and the people who work there are so friendly. The food I ordered was delicious as well but it would've tasted better if I didn't make it to go
author: Sienna H.

description:
Scallops not that good
Everything else just OK
Place has a weird vibe
author: Haiku Revue X.

description: Amazing place for a late night, post drinks food! Loved their spicy ramen. I don't take spicy but it was so good that I kept going. Tuna salad was very average and I prob wouldn't get it again. Their icing drink was great, but overpriced (I got the same bottle at h mart for $3, and they priced it at $10)
author: Yoon P.

description:
I was really looking forward to eating here with the girls and having an awesome experience.  The place is cute and we started off with cocktails, which was great.  So far so good and the customer service was excellent.  

When the food came, we were not impressed.  The fried chicken combo was not fried all the way so we were eating dough.  Luckily, none of us got sick from possible raw chicken.  We had to send this back to get it refried.  Apologies but nothing on the house.

The budaejigae (stew with spam, kimchee, noodles) was the smallest portion I've ever seen for this type of stew. It was not tasty at all.  The taste was completely off from what it's supposed to taste like. 

The fried rice was decent but nothing to boast about. 

We all left wanting to go somewhere else to redeem the night and the unsatisfying food experience.
author: Mary W.

description:
I've come here for brunch and dinner a few times.

The bloody mary is the best I've ever had. I do love a good bloody mary and this one stands out. (For those familiar with bloody marys, they do the Guiness trick, which is key.)

The fried chicken is excellent; not too greasy but still very crispy.

The waitstaff is also very friendly, and they're helpful when it comes to picking an order. I generally don't comment on service, but they go above and beyond here.

I was shocked at how empty the place was! Make sure to come here before it gets too popular. With food and service like theirs, it won't stay quiet for long.
author: Jake F.

description:
This place is great. Very tasty food, and you can't beat the price! They've just added a ton of yummy rice bowls to the menu, and a good rice bowl is my weakness. We had 2 entrees, an appetizer, and a beer for less than $40 -- a true rarity in SF these days. Would recommend for sure.

Oh, and the place is big enough to accommodate large parties, also a rarity in SF!
author: C C.

description: Misic was a little loud.  Loved the soft shell crab Benedict.  It's Korean fusion but Thai operated.  Would definitely go back.  Thought it would be busy on a Saturday morning around 10 AM but it was actually not too bad. Got seated quickly
author: Ragnar L.

description:
Delicious! Finished everything and had great service with no wait time. Would give 5 stars if there were a couple of minor changes:
- hot Barley tea 
- hotter stone pot to give some extra crispyness/texture

Next time we'll check out the brunch menu!
author: Vanessa T.

description:
Delicious food. Great food presentation. Drinks are a very fancy, but still good. 

Been here a few times, and hey keep upgrading and changing the venue to make it better. The appetizers are super good too
author: Shane L.

description:
EDIT: 3rd visit and this place keeps getting better. Keep it up!

Went to FSC twice in the last week since I live in the neighborhood, once for dinner and once for brunch. Two different experiences.

We visited for dinner toward the end of their soft opening. Overall I'd say the food was pretty good but the service was chaotic. Servers were very nice but came off untrained. It took a while to get anyone's attention and they handled our request for a paced meal very awkwardly, bringing out a main dish before anything else then taking it back (to put under a heat lamp...) after we complained. We also noticed that they don't have a host up front, so some groups stood up front for 5-10 mins without being greeted. 

For dinner we got the kimchi pancake, half & half KFC, galbi and bulgogi with soju cocktails. The galbi was overcooked and lacking in meat - at $25 it was the least "worth it" item we ordered. Kimchi pancake was very different than the traditional style - an umami junkie's dream overloaded with a layer of bonito flakes and Kewpie mayo on top. The KFC was definitely the standout dish of the meal though, and the half & half sauce is perfect.

During our second experience we very much enjoyed some improved service and the interesting brunch menu. We had more of the KFC and I tried the Mr. Katsu plate which is a Korean take on the Japanese classic. The place was less crowded and our server was great.

I hope this place gets some of the kinks out with its dinner service and puts some effort into getting the classic Korean BBQ dishes right. Overall though a really cool looking, funky restaurant with an upbeat vibe which can certainly become a go-to if it keeps trending up.
author: Narek A.

description: Food is sooo good and comes out so fresh and hot. Service is great. They shrunk their menu in half though recently and I really wish they wouldn't have. Or at least bring the sweet potato fries back!!! They were awesome!
author: Nina B.

description: The fried Kimchi here is perfect!!!!!!!! It's rare in SF. If you love good Korean food and wanna try something creative, this place is your best choice
author: Yufeng Y.

description: Great vibe, food is delicious, and a vibrant area. Very artsy styled and an inviting place to take any of your friends
author: Olga N.

description: Food is absolutely right and outstanding. We ordered 5 different dishes and everything was sooooooooo delicious. Staffs are super friendly n kind. Fancy food with reasonable price. This is the best restaurant around Japantown and Fillmore district.  Definitely, we will comeback. Five stars are not enough for them.
author: Hyemin O.

description: Found this place online and made a reservation on a whim. Food was so tasty and portions were generous will defn be coming here again
author: Jenelle A.

description: Delicious!!!! Great Korean Food for dinner in San Francisco. Superb taste, great & fantastic presentation, fun atmosphere and good service as well. Absolutely I will be back again and again
author: navapon s.

description: This place is not for the Korean customers. Koreans don't put the sunny side up fried eggs over their rice and having no side-dishes with the meal  is a no no.  I don't think I'll never try this place again.
author: Chris J.

description: This is a new spot and it is amazing. The staff is super friendly and the food is amazing. This is my second time here and I love this spot. The Pork Belly Pot is to die for. Pork Belly is seasoned perfectly and braised to just the right texture. The house made kimchi is great for the average person. I prefer a little spicier, but the flavors are all there. Definitely come check this spot out. The concept is amazing and can't wait to come back and try their Soft Shell Crab Benedict. 5 stars all around.
author: Chris T.

description: Delicious Korean and pan-Asian dishes. Definitely recommend the dinner over the brunch. Brunch food was fairly basic, but the dinner menu is awesome! Crowd pleasers are the tuna tower (on a fried rice patty-sort of like a rice hash brown) and the corn pancake. We loved the chicken on a stick (like a lollipop) but went recently and it was off the menu. Highly recommend!
author: Brit M.

description: This place is awesome, delicious and huge. I went for dinner with a friend and would love to go back with a group. Great venue, lots of space and kind waitresses.
author: An N.

description: This place is strange. Pumping club music, videos of Korean car shows and skateboarding, no real bar area. The menu seems interesting until you realize they add cheese to half the items. Including scallops. The dolsot was decent and no strange add ons. My friend got the ribs that came with a tomato sauce and asked for the cheese to be left off. Who wants cheese on ribs, much less Korean ribs? Service was a little spotty. Kimchi side was tiny for $3. I think I'll stick with the standard Korean places in Japan town.
author: Alexandra H.

description: Felt a bit gimmicky. The food was alright but the crab didn't taste that fresh, which made me nervous, and the prices were inflated.
author: Cella M.

description: Great place for large groups! I went here for brunch and tried the bulgogi entree, came with fried egg over white rice. The bulgogi was a bit dry.. but overall good atmosphere and good place for drinks. They have a large selection of alcoholic drinks
author: Vickie W.

description: Great new spot. Cool art work on the walls and nice interior design in general. The service was both prompt and friendly. I got the tofu stone bowl which I enjoyed. I often find Korean food too salty but the flavors and textures on this was really well executed.
author: Anna V.

description: Solid new restaurant with good Korean fusion food. Honestly, the next time I'm back I plan to only order two things: the chicken wings and sake
author: Patrick P.

description:
So glad this place has come to the Fillmore! Very tasty Korean menu with comfort food infused brunch offerings. Prices are average for SF brunch, with healthy portion sizes- most dishes could be split between two or more. 

We ordered a mix of Korean and American dishes and liked it all. Waffles were crispy on the outside and chewy inside, Korean fried chicken was crisp and moist, and the soy glazed version (Chi bap) was a nice variation. The soft shell Benedict was beautifully plated, and a side of millionaire's bacon hit the spot. The chicken jook was the one dish that needed a little something. The broth was tasty, but somehow the rice and barely cooked veggies made it feel a little bland. This didn't stop me from eating the whole bowl. 

The star might have been the corn flake crusted brioche French toast. This is a double French toast with an apple filling, maple syrup drizzle, and a mountain of mashed potato textured mascarpone garnished with fresh berries and a dehydrated orange slice on the side. Delicious and decadent. 

Service was very friendly and efficient--the restaurant was quiet when we got there but filled up by the time we left--glad they seem to be doing well! We'll be back for sure.
author: j-mo h.

description: We ordered the Belly Pot and Pork Cutlet brunch to share, along with a side of KFC. I was impressed with the Belly pot. It was like a really good char siu fan ( Chinese BBQ pork rice). It was savory porky delicious. The pork cutlet was flavorful but needed more sauce to moisten the  whole dish to balance it, otherwise the hot plate dry out the rice and pork. The KFC felt like it was missing the spicy garlicky sweet and sour sauce. Overall still a very good experience.
author: James T.

description: Not a very busy place but the servers and the food was top notch. A little pricey for whats given but the environment was very cool and modern.
author: Andrew D.

description: This is a very good place to social with friends. Environment is very good. And the food was good. It is very good. I'd probably go again with friends for drinks and food and plus very close to Japantown for more food and shopping.
author: Harriet C.

description: Came in for brunch last weekend and were amazed by the food! Not only was the presentation beautiful, it tasted amazing and came out quickly (which was good because we were in a hurry.) Nice clean, open space; wait staff were all friendly and on top of things.
author: Holly E.

description:
This restaurant basically serves the  Korean food.  
The service was good but felt  uncomfortable their sitting on their one knee. It also seem little 
pretentious. I would be more
comfortable being just normal. Regardless the service was descent. 
But  the food was too bland and sweet to be korean dishes. This is not for those who know how the Korean food supposed to taste like or those looking for authentic Korean dishes. 

I saw in the menu the Korean whiskey(Soju) which would normally cost 1.99 -3.99 at the Korean
Store, but it was selling in their own little fancy pitcher  for $30.00!!!!  I thought this was excessive and exorbitant considering what it really costs at a market.
author: Jon P.

description: This is probably my favorite brunch place in all of San Francisco. The staff was super friendly and Highly recommend
author: Chang L.

description: I had spicy calamari hot stone bowl and it was very tasty! I will definitely come back this place again.
author: EunJoo C.

description: At fillmore social club for brunch to start off the morning the right way. From the start the service was amazing and they said the kfc and waffles were delicious so enjoyed an amazing brunch along with tasty bottomless mimosa. I can def taste the quality in both. I love the fillmore but im so glad i have a neighborhood restaurant i can always depend on. Thank you for everything guys ill forsure be back for dinner service and more!!
author: Tony L.

description: Wow!  This place was amazing.  We went for Sunday Brunch and it exceeded our expectations.   The Soft Shell Crab Benedict and FSC French Toast mind blowing good.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Joe B.

description: Amazing new Korean fusion restaurant, try it out, you won't regret it! This place just opened and I couldn't have been happier with the experience! The service was above and beyond, the food was interesting, delicious and beautifully presented! The restaurants atmosphere is so fun and inviting with an incredible mural as well!
author: Aylee N.

description: The food is a delight! I have been here twice already and for me going to any restaurant twice means a big thumbs up. Every dish has its own unique mix of flavors and the plate sizes can feed 2 or more so great for sharing.
author: Kara W.

description: So so good! Great Korean/ Asian fusion spot in the lower Fillmore. The bulgogi, udon dish and dolsot where delicious and unexpectedly different from each other. The jalapeño peppers where also really good. Try the soju (similar to vodka) cocktails too. Nice decor and good service. Will definitely come back.
author: Maria Fernanda L.

description: This ramen dish was OK, good variety of bacon slices, some kind of sausage and veggies. The decor is very nice and clean.  The beef dish was very tender, 4 stars for that one.
author: Linh G.

description: For a super cute concept and nice restaurant layout, I'd say the food was okay. My friend and I came for dinner and ordered the fried chicken and Jazzy Army Stew. While I enjoyed both sauces and liked that the chicken was boneless, it wasn't crispy at all! It felt like it was fried and prepared ahead of time so it wasn't fresh when it arrived to our table. The stew was good and had lots of ingredients but wish it was served a bit warmer. The service was good though! Our server was nice and checked in often. I may be interested in trying their brunch menu next time.
author: Breanna T.

description: Really cute spot ! Great find. Had the masubi Benedict ! The art and atmosphere was great. My drink had flowers in the ice cubes ! The waiters were also really kind and explained the mural to us. Would come back again
author: Shirley L.

description:
Food was great(a bit overpriced), ambiance was great, very calm nice restaurant.
Downside? 
I noticed people who works at this restaurant has the bad habit to go outside and smoke while there is not much to do inside of the restaurant. Employers goes outside of the 1535 Eddy St residential building to smoke. We are very sensible when it comes to smells, so It can be a great service and food, but if the people who are supposed to be working smells like cigarettes, that's a red flag for me because it can be passed to the food and their clients.
Sorry guys, and good luck.
author: Sergio R.

description: Went here last night with some girlfriends and we will become regulars for sure! The food was soooooo good!! We ordered one of almost everything on the menu and not one dish disappointed! Mmmmm I'm glad I have some leftovers in my fridge otherwise I would have to go back again today!
author: Sahra Likes Coffee S.

description: If you like Korean food, this is a MUST try place. I ordered Moe Galbi, Grilled Scallop, and S.S. Sunomono - they are all sooo.. delicious. They also have some cool soju cocktails too. Price was reasonable and super friendly service. I'll be back to try other stuff for sure!
author: Thitikan J.

description: This restaurant is very cute modern korean restaurant. Best korean restaurant on San Francisco. Excellent service and all foods are so delicious.
author: Jina L.

description: Very good Korean Fusion. Great desert, must try! Have been there for 2 times already in the past 2 weeks.
author: Poppy W.

description: Originally planned on the Sweet Maple for a more traditional breakfast but they were closed and pointed us to their new concept.  It was fantastic.  Great flavor and presentation.  We had the chicken and waffle, the soft shell crab Benedict, and the egg bowl.  All three were very good!
author: Lou G.

description: So happy a great new place has finally taken over Gussie's. Delicious, inventive soju cocktails and even better food.
author: Cindi C.

description: Great food, reasonably priced. For two, we shared the Bolgogi and Spicy Golbi.  They were excellent. My wife had the soju cucumber cocktail. Way too sweet.  I splurged and had the Soju from the oldest Korean distillery. I can't remember the name but it was very good.
author: Robert L.

description: Honestly this is by far the best korean food restaurant ive been to in SF. Our waiter was SO nice and friendly and the entire time he was super attentive. Cocktails were super tasty, especially matcha one, loved it! The place is super hip and nice looking!  Food was so clean, so flavorful and very tasty. Very nicely porportioned and honestly every dish we had was very very good. I defintely will go back a LOT more often.
author: Christine K.

description: This has got to be my new favorite korean place in the Fillmore district, its a korean food with some twists, they open for brunch/lunch and dinner and of cause i came for both brunch/lunch and dinner for brunch i order Soft Shell Crab Benedict which is out of this world best Benedict i ever had! I also order Waffle & KFC it came with spicy maples syrup i know sound weird but god! U got best of both world sweet & spicy at the same time. We also order Hangover Shakshuka its a tomato stew crispy bacon, spam, and crispy rice cake with a lil kick to it that will cure your hangover hence the name and lastly we order Hot Stone Pot it is to die for and if u want the server can mix it up for you it great! Fresh squeezed orange juice and grapefruit juice, they got great drink for brunch bottomless mimosas and bottomless cocktails wow! I know i know im an alcoholic 555. A day later i came back for dinner again great selection on appetizers and food knowing me we order lots of food the Grilled Scallops, Tako Wasabi, Mango Poki. The Moe Galbi here is the bomb the short ribs seem to just melt in your mouth, the Half & Half its good if u like fried chicken, The Shakshuka Backribs it a mountain of ribs and cheese no need to say nothing  else! Their list of drink its pretty good too if u just wanna come and chill and hang out they soju cocktails, beer on taps, nice selection of sake and soju all and all its my new favorite place to hang out the staff are very nice they treat u like family.  I give this place a 5 start its a lil place u can come back time and time again.
author: Paul P.

description:
Loved their brunch. The steamed eggs (got it with bacon and avocado) were wonderful, and the Breakfast Taco Ssam was delicious. Bacon was thick and perfectly cooked. Each plate came with a fresh salad and creamy spinach mashed potatoes. 
Good coffee, friendly staff, quick service, spacious dining room, nice interior. We'll be back for brunch (and to try dinner).
author: Nicole C.

description: We ordered half and half fried chicken and something like bibimbap, and they all delicious. Such as its name - 'Social Club', you can share dishes with your friends and both of you will very full when you leaving. The decoration in restaurant full of artistic sense, so it is really good place to go with your friends. Service also friendly, and they very care about customers.
author: Noelle H.

description: I wish I had discovered this place sooner! It's in an unexpected spot but the brunch is really good with a Korean twist. I had the chicken and waffles which was the perfect combo of sweet and savory.  I also tried the eggs Benedict which was a nice twist on a classic breakfast staple. The absolute best thing about eating here was that the food is delicious and there was no line to get in... a hidden secret in SF!
author: Julie B.

description: We came here for dinner service. The food was excellent and the service was really good. We sat down right away and there was no line. The food was amazing especially the sticks, the chopstakes, ss sunomono, kimchi jun and I would recommend to try the cocktails. It's a must-try! I would definitely come back here again.
author: Tenzin D.

description: Fabulous Food, Great Presentation and atmosphere. Get the DolSot! Our first experience and it was great. We will be back.
author: Michele V.

description: My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our meals (chi bang and KFC and waffle).  The space is huge, aesthetically-pleasing, and super clean.  The staff is extremely attentive and friendly.  I am looking forward to trying the rest of the menu.
author: JJ M.

description: Awesome Korean BBQ Short Rib & Beef Bulgogi. The restaurant design and atmosphere is very cool. Excellent experience!
author: William Y.

description: Love this place! The staff is friendly and all of the food is really good. I've been there several times since it opened, ordered different things every time, and haven't had a bad meal yet. Their dolsot with bulgogi is my favorite dish there so far.
author: Kristen B.

description: Great service and friendly staff. Food was excellent, well seasoned and even if it's spicy it has just the right amount of heat. Interesting cocktails. Great addition to our neighborhood.
author: Th K.

description: Amazing service, staff very friendly and welcoming and food was great. Also amazing cocktails.
author: Mike S.
